history.proof: intros H. inversion H. - shelve. - shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment l : list bool H : list_bool_succ nil l k : nat l0 : list bool H1 : list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l0 = nil H0 : list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l0 = l Unable to unify "Zero :: list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l0" with "list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l0".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
l: list bool

Goal:
list_bool_succ nil l -> l = Zero :: nil

Premises:
Inductive list (A : Type) : Type := nil : list A | cons : A -> list A -> list A Arguments list _%type_scope Arguments nil {A}%type_scope Arguments cons {A}%type_scope a l%list_scope : rename
Notation Zero := false
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
Inductive list_bool_succ : list bool -> list bool -> Prop := in_lbs_0 : forall (k : nat) (l : list bool), list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l) | in_lbs_1 : forall k : nat, list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k) (list_repeat Zero (S k)) Arguments list_bool_succ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lbs_0 _%nat_scope _%list_scope Arguments in_lbs_1 _%nat_scope
list_bool_succ_fun : forall l m1 m2 : list bool, list_bool_succ l m1 -> list_bool_succ l m2 -> m1 = m2
app_removelast_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (d : A), l <> nil -> l = removelast l ++ last l d :: nil
Permutation.Permutation_length_2_inv : forall (A : Type) (a1 a2 : A) (l : list A), a1 :: a2 :: nil ~p l -> l = a1 :: a2 :: nil \/ l = a2 :: a1 :: nil
in_lbs_0 : forall (k : nat) (l : list bool), list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k ++ Zero :: l) (list_repeat Zero k ++ One :: l)
Permutation.Permutation_length_1_inv : forall (A : Type) (a : A) (l : list A), a :: nil ~p l -> l = a :: nil
Permutation.Permutation_nil : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), nil ~p l -> l = nil
Permutation.Permutation_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> list A -> Prop), P nil nil -> (forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> P l l' -> P (x :: l) (x :: l')) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), P (y :: x :: l) (x :: y :: l)) -> (forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> P l l' -> l' ~p l'' -> P l' l'' -> P l l'') -> forall l l0 : list A, l ~p l0 -> P l l0
list_One_Zero_inj : forall (a b : nat) (l m : list bool), list_repeat One a ++ Zero :: l = list_repeat One b ++ Zero :: m -> a = b /\ l = m
rev_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (x : A) (l : list A), P l -> P (l ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, P l
list_nat_bool = fix list_nat_bool (ln : list nat) : list bool := match ln with | nil => nil | x :: ll => list_repeat Zero x ++ One :: list_nat_bool ll end : list nat -> list bool Arguments list_nat_bool _%list_scope
nat_sorted_rect : forall P : list nat -> Type, P nil -> (forall x : nat, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : nat) (l : list nat), x < y -> P (y :: l) -> P (x :: y :: l)) -> forall l : list nat, nat_sorted l -> P l
list_bool_nat = fix list_bool_nat (l : list bool) : nat := match l with | nil => 1 | One :: l0 => 1 + 2 * list_bool_nat l0 | Zero :: l0 => 0 + 2 * list_bool_nat l0 end : list bool -> nat Arguments list_bool_nat _%list_scope
Inductive Permutation (A : Type) : list A -> list A -> Prop := perm_nil : nil ~p nil | perm_skip : forall (x : A) (l l' : list A), l ~p l' -> x :: l ~p x :: l' | perm_swap : forall (x y : A) (l : list A), y :: x :: l ~p x :: y :: l | perm_trans : forall l l' l'' : list A, l ~p l' -> l' ~p l'' -> l ~p l'' Arguments Permutation.Permutation [A]%type_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_nil _%type_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_skip [A]%type_scope _ [l l']%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_swap [A]%type_scope _ _ _%list_scope Arguments Permutation.perm_trans [A]%type_scope [l l' l'']%list_scope
exists_last : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l <> nil -> {l' : list A & {a : A | l = l' ++ a :: nil}}
in_lbs_1 : forall k : nat, list_bool_succ (list_repeat One k) (list_repeat Zero (S k))
Permutation.Permutation_cons_append : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (x : A), x :: l ~p l ++ x :: nil
app_nil_r : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l ++ nil = l
app_nil_end : forall (A : Type) (l : list A), l = l ++ nil
rev_list_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall (a : A) (l : list A), P (rev l) -> P (rev (a :: l))) -> forall l : list A, P (rev l)
Relation_Operators.Desc_sind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> SProp), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Relation_Operators.Desc_ind : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (P : list A -> Prop), P nil -> (forall x : A, P (x :: nil)) -> (forall (x y : A) (l : list A), Relation_Operators.clos_refl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Desc A leA (l ++ y :: nil) -> P (l ++ y :: nil) -> P ((l ++ y :: nil) ++ x :: nil)) -> forall l : list A, Relation_Operators.Desc A leA l -> P l
Inductive NoDup (A : Type) : list A -> Prop := NoDup_nil : NoDup nil | NoDup_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), ~ In x l -> NoDup l -> NoDup (x :: l) Arguments NoDup [A]%type_scope _%list_scope Arguments NoDup_nil _%type_scope Arguments NoDup_cons [A]%type_scope _ [l]%list_scope
bool_ring_ring_lemma2 : forall (n : nat) (lH : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (l : list bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lH -> forall lmp : list (bool * Ring_polynom.Mon * Ring_polynom.Pol bool), Ring_polynom.mk_monpol_list Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) bool_eq (triv_div Zero One bool_eq) lH = lmp ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe = Ring_polynom.Pphi_dev Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) Zero One bool_eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) (get_sign_None (C:=bool)) l npe
nat_list_insert = fix nat_list_insert (x : nat) (l : list nat) {struct l} : list nat := match l with | nil => x :: nil | y :: l0 => if x <? y then x :: y :: l0 else if y <? x then y :: nat_list_insert x l0 else y :: l0 end : nat -> list nat -> list nat Arguments nat_list_insert _%nat_scope _%list_scope
removelast_app : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A), l' <> nil -> removelast (l ++ l') = l ++ removelast l'
nil_cons : forall (A : Type) (x : A) (l : list A), nil <> x :: l
app_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a : A), x ++ y = a :: nil -> x = nil /\ y = a :: nil \/ x = a :: nil /\ y = nil
map_last : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (a : A), map f (l ++ a :: nil) = map f l ++ f a :: nil
Inductive Forall2 (A B : Type) (R : A -> B -> Prop) : list A -> list B -> Prop := Forall2_nil : Forall2 R nil nil | Forall2_cons : forall (x : A) (y : B) (l : list A) (l' : list B), R x y -> Forall2 R l l' -> Forall2 R (x :: l) (y :: l') Arguments Forall2 [A B]%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Forall2_nil [A B]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Forall2_cons [A B]%type_scope [R]%function_scope _ _ [l l']%list_scope
bool_ring_ring_lemma1 : forall (n : nat) (l : list bool) (lpe : list (Ring_polynom.PExpr bool * Ring_polynom.PExpr bool)) (pe1 pe2 : Ring_polynom.PExpr bool), Ring_polynom.interp_PElist Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) eq (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l lpe ->...-> Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe1 = Ring_polynom.PEeval Zero One xorb andb xorb (fun b : bool => b) (IDphi (R:=bool)) id_phi_N (pow_N One andb) l pe2
list_One_Zero_not : forall (a b : nat) (l : list bool), list_repeat One a ++ Zero :: l <> list_repeat One b
elt_eq_unit : forall (A : Type) (l1 l2 : list A) (a b : A), l1 ++ a :: l2 = b :: nil -> a = b /\ l1 = nil /\ l2 = nil
Forall2_nil_inv_l : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (m : list Y), Forall2 R nil m -> m = nil
Forall2_nil_inv_r : forall (X Y : Type) (R : X -> Y -> Prop) (m : list X), Forall2 R m nil -> m = nil
Ascii.N_of_digits = fix N_of_digits (l : list bool) : BinNums.N := match l with | nil => BinNums.N0 | b :: l' => BinNat.N.add (if b then BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH else BinNums.N0) (BinNat.N.mul (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (N_of_digits l')) end : list bool -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_digits _%list_scope
Inductive Forall (A : Type) (P : A -> Prop) : list A -> Prop := Forall_nil : Forall P nil | Forall_cons : forall (x : A) (l : list A), P x -> Forall P l -> Forall P (x :: l) Arguments Forall [A]%type_scope _%function_scope _%list_scope Arguments Forall_nil [A]%type_scope _%function_scope Arguments Forall_cons [A]%type_scope [P]%function_scope _ [l]%list_scope
app_inj_tail : forall (A : Type) (x y : list A) (a b : A), x ++ a :: nil = y ++ b :: nil -> x = y /\ a = b
ZMicromega.xnegate = fun f : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z => let (e, o) := f in match o with | RingMicromega.Equal => (e, RingMicromega.Equal) :: nil | RingMicromega.NonEqual => (ZMicromega.psub e (EnvRing.Pc (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH)), RingMicromega.NonStrict) :: (ZMicromega.psub (EnvRing.Pc (BinNums.Zneg BinNums.xH)) e, RingMicromega.NonStrict) :: nil | RingMicromega.Strict => (ZMicromega.psub e (EnvRing.Pc (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH)), RingMicromega.NonStrict) :: nil | RingMicromega.NonStrict => (e, RingMicromega.NonStrict) :: nil end : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z -> list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z)
ZMicromega.xnormalise = fun f : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z => let (e, o) := f in match o with | RingMicromega.Equal => (ZMicromega.psub e (EnvRing.Pc (BinNums.Zpos BinNums.xH)), RingMicromega.NonStrict) :: (ZMicromega.psub (EnvRing.Pc (BinNums.Zneg BinNums.xH)) e, RingMicromega.NonStrict) :: nil | RingMicromega.NonEqual => (e, RingMicromega.Equal) :: nil | RingMicromega.Strict => (ZMicromega.psub (EnvRing.Pc BinNums.Z0) e, RingMicromega.NonStrict) :: nil | RingMicromega.NonStrict => (ZMicromega.psub (EnvRing.Pc (BinNums.Zneg BinNums.xH)) e, RingMicromega.NonStrict) :: nil end : RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z -> list (RingMicromega.NFormula BinNums.Z)
Relation_Operators.Lt_nil : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA nil (a :: x)
